meanings.definition: Persuaded a customer to purchase a more expensive item or upgrade.
meanings.sent1: The salesperson upsold the customer to a larger size for only a few dollars more.
meanings.sent2: She always tries to upsell customers on the benefits of the premium package.
meanings.sent3: The clever salesperson upsold the customer on a deluxe upgrade, making them feel like a VIP.
meanings.sent4: He upsold the idea of upgrading to a luxury model as a way to treat oneself.
meanings.sent5: The salesperson's ability to upsell made the customer's decision easy and satisfying.

meanings.definition: The act of convincing a customer to buy additional products or services.
meanings.sent1: The upsold on the extended warranty increased the total purchase amount.
meanings.sent2: She received a bonus for every successful upsold she made.
meanings.sent3: The upsold on the extra accessories made the customer's day a little brighter.
meanings.sent4: The upsold on the maintenance plan was a smart choice for long-term savings.
meanings.sent5: The upsold on the premium service added extra value to the customer's experience.

meanings.definition: To sell a higher-priced version of a product or service.
meanings.sent1: The company always tries to upsell customers to the deluxe package.
meanings.sent2: He successfully upsold the customer to the top-tier product.
meanings.sent3: The salesperson upsold the customer to the luxury option, making them feel like a VIP.
meanings.sent4: She upsold the idea of upgrading to the premium version as a way to enjoy more features.
meanings.sent5: The ability to upsell the upgraded model made the customer's purchase more valuable.
